etymology.description: Originally ideogrammic: 屮 ‘vegetation’ + 田 ‘field’ (garden; original 圃). Later phono-semantic: semantic 用 + phonetic 父 (OC *paʔ).
etymology.interpretation: Initially depicted sprouting plants in a field, conveying the idea of a garden. It was later reanalyzed so that 父 supplied the sound while 用 hinted at meaning or served as the semantic anchor. Over time the shapes fused, obscuring the earlier components.

examples.chinese: 他甫到家，电话就响了(他甫到家，電話就響了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā fǔ dào jiā, diànhuà jiù xiǎng le.
examples.english: He had just arrived home when the phone rang.

examples.chinese: 甫一开门，冷风扑面而来(甫一開門，冷風撲面而來)。
examples.pinyin: Fǔ yī kāi mén, lěngfēng pūmiàn ér lái.
examples.english: As soon as the door was opened, a cold wind rushed in.

examples.chinese: 新政甫行，百姓尚未适应(新政甫行，百姓尚未適應)。
examples.pinyin: Xīnzhèng fǔ xíng, bǎixìng shàngwèi shìyìng.
examples.english: The new policy has just been put into effect, and the people have not yet adapted.
